metadata.title: CVE-2015-5234 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
IcedTea-Web before 1.5.3 and 1.6.x before 1.6.1 does not properly sanitizeapplet URLs, which allows remote attackers to inject applets into the.appletTrustSettings configuration file and bypass user approval to executethe applet via a crafted web page, possibly related to line breaks.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-5234` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

icedtea-6-plugin - 1.5.3-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
icedtea-7-plugin - 1.5.3-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
icedtea-netx - 1.5.3-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
icedtea-netx-common - 1.5.3-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
icedtea-plugin - 1.5.3-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: icedtea-web package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.5.3-0ubuntu0.14.04.1').
